title: Lattice path
summary: In combinatorics, a lattice path L in the d-dimensional integer lattice Z d {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} ^{d}} of length k with steps in the set S, is a sequence of vectors v 0 , v 1 , … , v k ∈ Z d {\displaystyle v_{0},v_{1},\ldots ,v_{k}\in \mathbb {Z} ^{d}} such that each consecutive difference v i − v i − 1 {\displaystyle v_{i}-v_{i-1}} lies in S.[1] A lattice path may lie in any lattice in R d {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{d}} ,[1] but the integer lattice Z d {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} ^{d}} is most commonly used.
